stories.title: HackHound 3.0
stories.location: SRM Modinagar Campus, Delhi NCR, UP
description: I participated in HackHound 3.0, a 2-day hackathon at SRM Modinagar Campus, organized by the university's tech community. It was an incredible experience collaborating with talented peers and engaging with the vibrant tech ecosystem.

Our team developed a project called MahaKumbh, a comprehensive web application designed to enhance the experience of devotees attending the Maha Kumbh Mela. The platform provides real-time stampede  updates, crowd management, and essential information for pilgrims.

We built the application using React for the frontend, Node.js with Express for the backend, MongoDB for the database, and integrated APIs for real-time data and user authentication, YOLO for object detection, and Streamlit for visualization.

project.name: MahaKumbh
project.description: A web application to assist devotees at Maha Kumbh Mela with real-time updates, crowd management, and essential services.

outcomes: üèÜ Secured a spot in the Top 10 shortlisted teams out of a fierce pool of innovators
üéØ Won the MongoDB and Streamlit track Winner title
üîß Took home a 37-sensor kit and an Arduino R4 board as prizes

stories.title: HackN'dore
description: I had the opportunity to attend a 3-day hackathon in Indore named HackN'dore, organized by IMC Indore at Acropolis College. It was an exhilarating experience where I was part of a team of five students, including Pratham Sharma, Yuvraj Yadav, Tejaswa Jhode, Yogesh Jat, and myself. We were all excited to showcase our skills and collaborate on innovative projects.

During the event, we had the chance to meet the Mayor of Indore, which was a remarkable experience. The Mayor's presence added a sense of importance and recognition to the event, and we were thrilled to interact with such a distinguished personality. This interaction provided us with valuable insights and encouragement to pursue our goals.

Apart from the competition, the hackathon was a great platform for networking. We made connections with many like-minded individuals and industry professionals. The event was not just about coding but also about learning, sharing knowledge, and building relationships that could help us in our future endeavors.

project.name: Water Supply Management System
project.description: Developed a system to monitor water supply in real-time

stories.title: DevsHouse
description: I had attended a 3-day hackathon named DevsHouse at VIT Chennai, organized by GDSC of that College. It was my first hackathon and I had a great experience interacting with new people from the south and the tech community there.

We made a project called OTAx, which is an Order Tracking Accompany application. It includes three types of users: driver, buyer, and manager of services. Users can track the real-time location of the truck driver and details of the truck driver associated with the package, which is updated by the manager.
We built it using Node.js as the backend, React as the frontend with TailwindCSS, and MongoDB as the database.

project.name: OTAx
project.description: An application for real-time order tracking with different user roles

outcomes: Enhanced team collaboration and technical skills

stories.title: Codathon 2.0
description: Codathon 2.0 was a 3-day competitive contest held in our college, organized by IETE in collaboration with Coding Ninjas. The event featured three rounds of intense competition.

Our team, consisting of Pratham Sharma and myself, successfully reached the final round and were among the top 10 teams in the college. It was an exhilarating experience solving DSA coding questions and applying programming logic.
The event provided a great platform to test our skills, learn new concepts, and interact with fellow coders.

project.name: Code Competition Platform
project.description: Created a real-time code compilation and competition platform
